channel.title: I am making a mod.
channel.description:
Ok, Now i am requesting help of people who wish to make a mod, The more people the better, we are on our way to developing a story-line, and I will start making a simple map tomarrow.
[url]https://www.moddb.com/mods/inceptive-defect[/url]
[url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_D7Y4fgzA_UE[/url] --- Jetpack! (second iteration, steady increase when holding space).
[b]Mod Name is:[/b] Inceptive Defect
[b]Current Members:[/b] -Storyline- Adam -Mapping - Dipi11 Abomination {{TG}} Adrian
-Modeling - JamiezRascall Abomination
-Texturing - Abomination
-Coding - Abomination(Sigh)
-Animating - NONE Maybe Jamiez
-Sounds - Dipi11
-Modeling Concept Art- NONE
I am accepting help in ANY of the ones that only have me, or none. ESPECIALLY TEXTURING.

item.title: I am making a mod.
item.dc:creator: abomination
item.description:
Just run from sourcesdk2007 with these params:

-allowdebug -dev -sw -game “C:\Program Files\Steam\SteamApps\SourceMods\MODNAME”

that or do it in debug.
AND ADD ME ON STEAM! Haha, we could be of use to eachother.

Read full topic

item.title: I am making a mod.
item.dc:creator: Jack_Freeman
item.description:
JeffMOD:

You can check to see if there’s a file called gameinfo.txt in your sourcemods/mymodfolder directory; maybe steam isn’t recognizing it as a mod because there’s no definition for it.

Steam can see my mod but when i launch it (after i coded it for the first time) it comes with an error it says this

Setuparrayprops (null) index is at zero

i cant do anything about it.

Read full topic

item.title: I am making a mod.

Thats true, We’re already getting a layout done for the first section of the game (in dev textures) and I’ve already implemented one of the major coding projects, very small and easy to do (thank you JamesKane). Ill be posting a video in the thread later today. I’ve also created a moddb page it just has basic modeling pictures it says they remove under-developed mods and mods with just a story-line so i uploaded though, the video is being uploaded to the media section there aswell, as will further releases.

Read full topic

item.title: I am making a mod.
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
Paddy:

You might be better off making a multiplayer mod, and focusing on the gameplay mechanics. Without a full team, your going to be limiting your self heavily when it comes to single player.

Actually, MP is more difficult to mod for than SP- since you have multiplayer stuff, that means you’d have to balance the game’s weapons and maps and God knows what else. With SP you have more control over the player, where he goes, and what he can see. Plus, NPCs are the primary opposition to the player, so the mapper has a greater degree of control over the flow of combat encounters.

Read full topic
